section.text: *NOTE: This section was created by emergency legislation that will expire on February 2, 2025.*
section.heading: Throwing projectiles at residential property.

para.text: It is unlawful for any person to launch or throw a projectile onto the residential property of another with the intent to cause fear, intimidate, or retaliate against any person living or working at that residence.
A person who violates this section, upon conviction, shall be fined no more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01, or incarcerated for no more than 90 days, or both.
